title: Atlas Meat Company Recalls Pork Products Due To Misbranding
summary: WASHINGTON, Jan. 25, 2017 Atlas Meat Company, a Fort Collins, Colo. establishment, is recalling approximately 2,579 pounds of pork sausage products due to misbranding, the U.S. Department of Agricultures Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products may contain monosodium glutamate (MSG), which...

establishment.name: Atlas Meat Company
establishment.address:
4020 John Deere Dr. 
  Fort Collins, CO 80524

impacted_products: 0.80 to 1.5-lb. vacuum-sealed or butcher paper wrapped packages containing “Atlas Meat Pork Breakfast Ssg.”
0.80 to 1.5-lb. vacuum-sealed or butcher paper wrapped packages containing “Atlas Meat Pork Italian ssg.”
